accessibilityRules.name: DescriptiveErrorMessages
accessibilityRules.description: Error messages must be clear, descriptive, and actionable
requirements: Provide guidance on how to fix it

examples.good: Product name is required. Please provide a name between 1-100 characters.

accessibilityRules.name: ConsistentResponseFormat
accessibilityRules.description: Use consistent, predictable response formats across all endpoints

accessibilityRules.name: LocalizationSupport
accessibilityRules.description: Support multiple languages for error messages and responses
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use resource files (.resx) for all user-facing text

accessibilityRules.name: SemanticNaming
accessibilityRules.description: Use clear, semantic names for endpoints, parameters, and responses
badPatterns: x, y, z as parameter names

accessibilityRules.name: InclusiveLanguage
accessibilityRules.description: Use inclusive, non-discriminatory language in code and documentation

accessibilityRules.name: HelpfulValidationMessages
accessibilityRules.description: Validation messages should guide users to correct input

examples.good: Email must be in format: user@example.com

accessibilityRules.name: StatusCodeDescriptions
accessibilityRules.description: Include human-readable descriptions with HTTP status codes

accessibilityRules.name: ApiDocumentation
accessibilityRules.description: All public endpoints must have XML documentation

accessibilityRules.name: ConsistentNaming
accessibilityRules.description: Use consistent naming conventions across the API

accessibilityRules.name: ClearHttpMethods
accessibilityRules.description: Use HTTP methods semantically and consistently

characteristics: Free of jargon and technical terms

implementation: Fall back to default language if not supported
Include language in ProblemDetails if relevant

inclusiveLanguage.principle: Use language that is respectful and inclusive of all people
guidelines: Avoid idioms that may not translate well

bestPractices: Test API with screen readers if providing UI
Use semantic HTML if generating HTML responses
Provide text alternatives for non-text content
Ensure sufficient color contrast in any UI
Support keyboard navigation in any interactive elements
Test with users who have diverse abilities
Consider cognitive load in API design
